project2.Account

    This class is a subclass of the Accounts class.
    class  MoneyMarket
    MoneyMarket class is a subclass of the Accounts class.

    Savings class is a subclass of the Accounts class.
    Fields in project2 declared as Account 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Account[] AccountDatabase.accounts  
    Methods in project2 that return Account 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private static Account TransactionManager.depositWithdrawClose​(java.util.Scanner sc, char accountType, java.lang.String input)
    This method creates and returns an account that we need to find in the 'bank' data field and then either deposit to, withdraw from, or close this account.
    private static Account TransactionManager.getAccountToOpen​(java.util.Scanner sc, char accountType)
    Returns the corresponding account to open by creating a new account of the respective type (checking, savings, Money Market) by reading in the input.
    Methods in project2 with parameters of type Account 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean AccountDatabase.add​(Account account)
    Add() is a method that adds the parameter account into the accounts array.
    boolean AccountDatabase.deposit​(Account account, double amount)
    deposit() is a method that adds a specific parameter amount to the parameterized account object.
    private static void AccountDatabase.exchangeAccount​(Account[] array, int index1, int index2)
    exchangeAccount() is a helper method that swaps two accounts in the accounts array using a standard swapping procedure.
    private int AccountDatabase.find​(Account account)
    find() is a method that iterates through the accounts array and returns the index of the parameterized account, if it exists in the array.
    boolean AccountDatabase.remove​(Account account)
    This method finds the account in the array.
    int AccountDatabase.withdrawal​(Account account, double amount)
    This method tries the find the account in the array, and if the account is found then the balance is checked to see if it is sufficient for the withdrawal.
